subject: Climate & Environment
title: How the Ocean Regulates Climate
description: A quick win: understand How the Ocean Regulates Climate.

hook.text: The ocean has absorbed over 90% of the extra heat trapped by greenhouse gases since 1970.

buildup.text: Water holds 1,000 times more heat than air. The ocean is Earth's giant thermal battery.

discovery.text: Without the ocean absorbing that heat, the atmosphere would already be far hotter.

twist.text: But the ocean is reaching its limits. Surface waters are warming faster than ever recorded.

climax.text: Warmer oceans fuel stronger storms, bleach corals, and raise sea levels as water expands.

punchline.text: The ocean hid most of the warming. Now it's sending it back.

quiz.question: What percentage of extra heat has the ocean absorbed since 1970?
